title: China to Its People: Spies Are Everywhere, Help Us Catch Them
description: As Beijing tries to enlist the “whole of society” to guard against foreign enemies, the line between vigilance and paranoia fades.

title: Officials Knew of Problems at Building That Caught Fire in South Africa
description: An extensive paper trail reveals that the authorities in Johannesburg were warned repeatedly about the dangers in the derelict building where 76 people died in a fire this week.

title: Officials in South Africa Knew About the Problems at a ‘Bad Building,’ but Did Nothing
description: An extensive paper trail reveals that the authorities in Johannesburg knew about the litany of dangers in the derelict building where 76 people died in a fire this week.

title: A Nation With Few Catholics Gives Pope a Welcome Fit for an Emperor
description: Mongolia put its history and culture on display as Pope Francis visited the Asian nation. Although it was the first trip to the country by a Roman Catholic pontiff, he noted that the two entities have ties dating back many centuries.

title: Nobel Foundation Withdraws Invitation to Russia and Belarus
description: The foundation, which had barred both countries last year because of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, changed course again after the move drew outrage.

title: Russia Says It Thwarted Another Attack on the Kerch Strait Bridge
description: Russia’s Ministry of Defense said it had destroyed three sea drones targeting the Kerch Strait Bridge, a vital supply line for Moscow’s forces that links occupied Crimea to Russia.

title: Democracy in Bangladesh Is Quietly Being Crushed
description: The most active rivals to the country’s ruling party face dozens, even hundreds, of court cases each, paralyzing the opposition as a crucial election approaches.

title: A Crackdown on Free Speech in Jordan
description: A satirical Arabic website, much like The Onion, poked fun at a royal wedding in Jordan in June. Not long after, it was blocked. “We’re totally backsliding,” said one cartoonist in the kingdom.

title: New Evidence in 2014 Mass Kidnapping of Students in Iguala, Mexico
description: The Mexican police, military officers and others secretly colluded with a cartel that kidnapped 43 students, a case unsolved after nearly a decade. Wiretaps show just how much the authorities helped the cartel behind the mass abduction, and what led to it.

title: Cross-Cultural Exchanges from Vietnam, Ethiopia, the Caribbean
description: Solo shows also abound, from Charles Gaines to Harry Smith, while the women of Land Art and Fluxus keep rocking in major exhibitions.

title: India Launches Its First Solar Mission
description: The goal is to study the sun’s outer layers, to better understand its physics and dynamics and to improve understanding of space weather.

title: Europe’s Boars Still Hold Radioactivity. What Surprised Scientists Is Why.
description: Some wild boar hunted in German forests have radiation levels that exceed the limit deemed safe for human consumption. New research suggests that it’s not just because of Chernobyl.

title: Ukraine’s Counteroffensive Pushes Forward, Village by Village
description: As Ukraine pushes slowly forward in its counteroffensive, it’s relying heavily on the effort of hundreds of small-scale assault groups, each tasked with attacking a single trench, tree line or house.
